snippet: Berkeley, a California city that has prided itself on its liberal policies, will require medical marijuana dispensaries to donate at least 2 percent of their cannabis to low-income residents.
abstract: Berkley, Calif, enacts law that will require medical marijuana dispensaries in city to donate at least 2 percent of their cannabis to low-income residents; move is provoking backlash from critics who mock it as a tie-dyed fantasy in a city already famous for liberal experiments.
lead_paragraph: Berkeley, a California city that has prided itself on its liberal policies, will require medical marijuana dispensaries to donate at least 2 percent of their cannabis to low-income residents.

headline.main: Berkeley Pushes a Boundary on Medical Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Berkeley Pushes a Boundary on Medical Marijuana
